body:
I know Ruqqus is fairly small right now but surely someone will know the answer to this, does anyone know of dating sites that aren't:

. Forcing you to pay money for absolutely basic features such as likes and not letting you see who liked you

. Infested with obvious spam bots and scam accounts

. Infested with Thots advertising their instagrams and snapchats

. Borderline scam sites themselves that are just designed to try and take money from desperate single men

The SEO 'experts' have gotten to the search engine results when it comes to dating sites and they have made it fucking impossible to find legitimate alternatives because whenever you put the words 'free' in and so on they've spammed trash articles directing you towards these shitty sites that we all know about so it would be nice to find out about real alternatives. I am quite sympathetic from a programmer perspective to anyone who's genuinely looking for somebody to even casually talk to during the lockdown that's single because the mainstream dating websites like OKCupid and Tinder are absolute bug riddled cancer.

author.bio: Considering whether to delete my account. Decided to just set my profile private for now.
author.bio_html: Considering whether to delete my account. Decided to just set my profile private for now.

body:
There are dating sites that meet your criteria, like https://alovoa.herokuapp.com/.

Unfortunately, I do not believe that there are any that meet a fifth criterion: "There are women with accounts there."

Dating sites suffer from exactly the same problem as Reddit: when it gets big, it gets expensive and complicated, and corporate interests supercede user interests.

We can create a small, donation-based Reddit because we don't mind hanging out with the same 200 crazy anti-semites. But it's hard to see how the same could be done for dating sites, where you absolutely need a few hundred people from every city, or the site is basically unusable.

I've been doing some industry research (as part of a long debate with incels) and I've come to believe that the majority of relationships today start on ordinary social media. That it's all about sliding into those DMs.
body_html:
There are dating sites that meet your criteria, like https://alovoa.herokuapp.com/.

Unfortunately, I do not believe that there are any that meet a fifth criterion: "There are women with accounts there."

Dating sites suffer from exactly the same problem as Reddit: when it gets big, it gets expensive and complicated, and corporate interests supercede user interests.

We can create a small, donation-based Reddit because we don't mind hanging out with the same 200 crazy anti-semites. But it's hard to see how the same could be done for dating sites, where you absolutely need a few hundred people from every city, or the site is basically unusable.

I've been doing some industry research (as part of a long debate with incels) and I've come to believe that the majority of relationships today start on ordinary social media. That it's all about sliding into those DMs.

body:
The internet has broken dating. You will never find a free dating website that meets your criteria; I doubt you can find one worth paying for.

I recommend reading (or, if you like his voice, listening to) Aziz Ansari's Modern Romance. It won't get you any online dates, but it will help you understand the broken system.
body_html:
The internet has broken dating. You will never find a free dating website that meets your criteria; I doubt you can find one worth paying for.

I recommend reading (or, if you like his voice, listening to) Aziz Ansari's Modern Romance. It won't get you any online dates, but it will help you understand the broken system.

parent.body:
There are dating sites that meet your criteria, like https://alovoa.herokuapp.com/.

Unfortunately, I do not believe that there are any that meet a fifth criterion: "There are women with accounts there."

Dating sites suffer from exactly the same problem as Reddit: when it gets big, it gets expensive and complicated, and corporate interests supercede user interests.

We can create a small, donation-based Reddit because we don't mind hanging out with the same 200 crazy anti-semites. But it's hard to see how the same could be done for dating sites, where you absolutely need a few hundred people from every city, or the site is basically unusable.

I've been doing some industry research (as part of a long debate with incels) and I've come to believe that the majority of relationships today start on ordinary social media. That it's all about sliding into those DMs.

body:
Any success with them entirely depends on your attractiveness and the site that’s most used in your geographic area. Saying that, none meet your asks. They are basically all spam filled cancer for Instagram and picky women who usually delete their accounts within a month. You can get laid from Tinder and others if you play the numbers game of course, quality depends on your appearance and game to actually get it offline. 


My experience/advice is this.

Tinder = Hookup

Bumble = Dates usually with 30+

OkCupid = Depends on location, largely crap now

PoF = Used to be better, now they hide crap like the others and so many bots and inactive accounts. 

Others = Waste of Time or absolute scams.

If you’re looking to get laid play the numbers game. If you for some reason think marriage is a good idea today (it’s not) go socialize and meet someone in your social group/friends social group.

parent.body:
There are dating sites that meet your criteria, like https://alovoa.herokuapp.com/.

Unfortunately, I do not believe that there are any that meet a fifth criterion: "There are women with accounts there."

Dating sites suffer from exactly the same problem as Reddit: when it gets big, it gets expensive and complicated, and corporate interests supercede user interests.

We can create a small, donation-based Reddit because we don't mind hanging out with the same 200 crazy anti-semites. But it's hard to see how the same could be done for dating sites, where you absolutely need a few hundred people from every city, or the site is basically unusable.

I've been doing some industry research (as part of a long debate with incels) and I've come to believe that the majority of relationships today start on ordinary social media. That it's all about sliding into those DMs.
parent.body_html:

Dating sites suffer from exactly the same problem as Reddit: when it gets big, it gets expensive and complicated, and corporate interests supercede user interests.

We can create a small, donation-based Reddit because we don't mind hanging out with the same 200 crazy anti-semites. But it's hard to see how the same could be done for dating sites, where you absolutely need a few hundred people from every city, or the site is basically unusable.

I've been doing some industry research (as part of a long debate with incels) and I've come to believe that the majority of relationships today start on ordinary social media. That it's all about sliding into those DMs.

body: You're right it is a numbers game unfortunately and based purely on percentage chances the joke is whenever I do get matches it's often women outside my country as if I didn't need my prejudices confirmed because women in my country just don't seem interested in me in the slightest. You've got no choice but to cast the net as wide as possible in the hopes of finding somebody can even hold a conversation lol. The joke is western women really did set this as the precedent because they've effectively made it illegal for a man to approach a woman RL these days since they've decided it's inappropriate to try talking them up in any situation. I think online dating could be salvaged if there was enough will behind it but it's a case of there don't seem to be any true alt-tech alternatives out there for now.

body:
We need a dating platform that has a human element, this is the ONE person you get to talk to this week based on attractiveness, interests, and some basic moral/relationship beliefs. The data is very clear women can't handle online dating successfully and match only on the top percentile of men. Meanwhile, men swipe/select largely on a fair and reasonable curve. This frustrates women of course and you end up with 2:1 or worse men to women ratios and the cycle repeats until the newest dating app comes out with some other bullshit that "fixes" the community. A *lot* of dating sites have shared this data publically over the years, it's always the same problem fundamentally. 

The only way a dating site will be "successful" for actual relationship building is to eliminate (mostly women's) selection control and make matches for you. This forces women to talk to reasonable matches and eliminates the mass spam problem they get entirely. You have to bring the human part back to it, and stop the "I'm talking to 50 matches at once" concept altogether.
body_html:
We need a dating platform that has a human element, this is the ONE person you get to talk to this week based on attractiveness, interests, and some basic moral/relationship beliefs. The data is very clear women can't handle online dating successfully and match only on the top percentile of men. Meanwhile, men swipe/select largely on a fair and reasonable curve. This frustrates women of course and you end up with 2:1 or worse men to women ratios and the cycle repeats until the newest dating app comes out with some other bullshit that "fixes" the community. A lot of dating sites have shared this data publically over the years, it's always the same problem fundamentally.

The only way a dating site will be "successful" for actual relationship building is to eliminate (mostly women's) selection control and make matches for you. This forces women to talk to reasonable matches and eliminates the mass spam problem they get entirely. You have to bring the human part back to it, and stop the "I'm talking to 50 matches at once" concept altogether.

. Forcing you to pay money for absolutely basic features such as likes and not letting you see who liked you

. Infested with obvious spam bots and scam accounts

. Infested with Thots advertising their instagrams and snapchats

. Borderline scam sites themselves that are just designed to try and take money from desperate single men

The SEO 'experts' have gotten to the search engine results when it comes to dating sites and they have made it fucking impossible to find legitimate alternatives because whenever you put the words 'free' in and so on they've spammed trash articles directing you towards these shitty sites that we all know about so it would be nice to find out about real alternatives. I am quite sympathetic from a programmer perspective to anyone who's genuinely looking for somebody to even casually talk to during the lockdown that's single because the mainstream dating websites like OKCupid and Tinder are absolute bug riddled cancer.

body:
> Unfortunately, I do not believe that there are any that meet a fifth criterion: "There are women with accounts there."

That's universal though. Men almost always make the first move because they're usually utterly desperate for a SO, but most women are perfectly happy on their own and can afford to avoid the pressure. So they're not going to have as much interest in dating sites as men.
body_html:
Unfortunately, I do not believe that there are any that meet a fifth criterion: "There are women with accounts there."

That's universal though. Men almost always make the first move because they're usually utterly desperate for a SO, but most women are perfectly happy on their own and can afford to avoid the pressure. So they're not going to have as much interest in dating sites as men.

parent.body:
There are dating sites that meet your criteria, like https://alovoa.herokuapp.com/.

Unfortunately, I do not believe that there are any that meet a fifth criterion: "There are women with accounts there."

Dating sites suffer from exactly the same problem as Reddit: when it gets big, it gets expensive and complicated, and corporate interests supercede user interests.

We can create a small, donation-based Reddit because we don't mind hanging out with the same 200 crazy anti-semites. But it's hard to see how the same could be done for dating sites, where you absolutely need a few hundred people from every city, or the site is basically unusable.

I've been doing some industry research (as part of a long debate with incels) and I've come to believe that the majority of relationships today start on ordinary social media. That it's all about sliding into those DMs.
parent.body_html:
There are dating sites that meet your criteria, like https://alovoa.herokuapp.com/.

Unfortunately, I do not believe that there are any that meet a fifth criterion: "There are women with accounts there."

Dating sites suffer from exactly the same problem as Reddit: when it gets big, it gets expensive and complicated, and corporate interests supercede user interests.

We can create a small, donation-based Reddit because we don't mind hanging out with the same 200 crazy anti-semites. But it's hard to see how the same could be done for dating sites, where you absolutely need a few hundred people from every city, or the site is basically unusable.

I've been doing some industry research (as part of a long debate with incels) and I've come to believe that the majority of relationships today start on ordinary social media. That it's all about sliding into those DMs.

body: Oh shit yeah, I actually do know about him as it turns out these left wingers are often all the same though, guy had an awkward date and made the girl feel uncomfortable it wasn't rape by a long shot. Many of these left wing men often have pretty bad history with women and it always come back to bite them in the arse which is why they virtue signal so hard about women's rights. Or alternatively they use it as a shield to treat women badly.

IMHO if you can find the courage to accuse someone on the internet, you can find the courage to file a police report.
